transcript.title: ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS - STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, MR JOHN GORTON
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS PM. No. 71/ 1970
ECONOMIC CONSULTATIONS
Statement by the Prime Minister, Mr John Gorton
The Government began its pre-Budget series of
economic consultations in Canberra today.
In the morning, Ministers had separate diiscussions
with representatives of the Manufacturing Industries Advisory
Council, the Export Development Council and the Australian Council
z3f Trade Urnors. In the afternoon, Ministers conferred with national
organisations in two separate groups primary industry and
manufacturing industry. The discussions will continue tomorrow when
Ministers will meet representatives of national organisations in the
field of commerce. These economic consultations are valuable in
providing Ministers at first hand with the views of those directly
engaged in commerce and industry, and the discussions today and
tomorrow will be of considerable assistance to the Government in its
consideration of the forthcoming Budget.
CANBERRA, 2 July 1970
